MV_CAMCTRL_API int __stdcall MV_CC_DisplayOneFrame (IN void *handle, IN MV_DISPLAY_FRAME_INFO *pstDisplayInfo)

Detailed Description

Display one frame of image.

Function Documentation

◆ MV_CC_DisplayOneFrame()

MV_CAMCTRL_API int __stdcall MV_CC_DisplayOneFrame ( IN void *  handle,
IN MV_DISPLAY_FRAME_INFO *  pstDisplayInfo 
)

Display one frame of image.

Parameters
handle[IN] Device handle
pstDisplayInfo[IN] Image information
Returns
Return MV_OK on success, and return Error Code on failure.
Note
 •  The rendering mode can be set to opengl.
  • The GDI mode GDI is applicable to all computers with no requirements on graphic card performance.
  • The D3D mode is applicable to computers with installed graphic card of memory larger than 1 GB. In this mode, the live view image on the client will be better than the one in GDI mode.
Examples
Display.cpp.

◆ MV_CC_DisplayOneFrameEx()

MV_CAMCTRL_API int __stdcall MV_CC_DisplayOneFrameEx ( IN void *  handle,
IN void *  hWnd,
IN MV_DISPLAY_FRAME_INFO_EX *  pstDisplayInfo 
)

Display one frame of image (extended API)

Parameters
handle[IN] Device handle
hWnd[IN] Window handle
pstDisplayInfo[IN] Image information
Returns
Return MV_OK on success, and return Error Code on failure.
Note
 •  The rendering mode can be set to opengl.
  • The GDI mode GDI is applicable to all computers with no requirements on graphic card performance.
  • The D3D mode is applicable to computers with installed graphic card of memory larger than 1 GB. In this mode, the live view image on the client will be better than the one in GDI mode.
 • Differences between MV_CC_DisplayOneFrameEx() and MV_CC_DisplayOneFrame() are as followsï¼š
  • MV_CC_DisplayOneFrameEx(): supports setting the rendering width and height of PixelType_Gvsp_RGB8_Packed, PixelType_Gvsp_BGR8_Packed, and PixelType_Gvsp_Mono8, and supports setting the rendering width and height of other pixel formats to short type only.
  • MV_CC_DisplayOneFrame(): supports setting the width and height of image to short type only.
  • For MV_DISPLAY_FRAME_INFO and MV_DISPLAY_FRAME_INFO_EX, the definitions of width/height are short and int type respectively.
